alert.note: Alert for Eastern Norfolk; Eastern Plymouth; Suffolk; Western Norfolk; Western Plymouth (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 3:33PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Norfolk, southern Suffolk and northwestern Plymouth Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 333 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Norfolk, or near Franklin, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Boston, Brockton, Quincy, Weymouth, Braintree, Randolph, Franklin, Norwood, Milton, Stoughton, Dedham, Walpole, Hingham, Canton, Sharon, Rockland, Foxborough, Abington, Westwood, and Medway. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Norfolk; Eastern Plymouth; Suffolk; Western Norfolk; Western Plymouth
